techmeme.title: The Intel Foundry Technology Research team announces breakthroughs in interconnect scaling, gate-all-around transistors, and packaging (Paul Alcorn/Tom's Hardware)
Broadcom shelves plans to work directly with the top 2,000 VMware customers, focusing on just 500 and giving 1,500 back to partners as a way to stem migrations (Simon Sharwood/The Register)
CapitaLand: Asia Pacific's colocation data center market is expected to grow to $52.2B by 2026, up from $25.5B in 2022, driven by demand for AI-based services (Reuters)
A White House official says that the US believes China-linked Salt Typhoon hackers targeted and recorded the phone calls of "very senior" US political figures (Alexander Cornwell/Reuters)
David Sacks, who called OpenAI a "piranha for-profit company", becoming AI czar comes at a delicate moment for OpenAI as it transitions to a for-profit (Sharon Goldman/Fortune)
